# Getting Started

Welcome to the BYU Associate Product Manager (APM) Internship Program. This guide will help you hit the ground running.

## Before Your Start Date (Pre-Internship)

Companies may begin onboarding early, so you might be contacted before January 7:

- [ ] Connect with your assigned mentor/manager
- [ ] Confirm your work schedule and location (remote or in-person)
- [ ] Set up any required accounts or access
- [ ] Get context about the team and projects
- [ ] Discuss initial goals and expectations
- [ ] Review the [Program Overview](../index.qmd)

Early onboarding is encouraged so you can hit the ground running on January 7.

## First Week Checklist

- [ ] Attend onboarding meeting with your mentor
- [ ] Clarify goals, scope, and priorities for your internship
- [ ] Understand team communication norms (Slack, email, meetings)
- [ ] Set up your development environment if applicable
- [ ] Schedule recurring check-ins (minimum 1x per week recommended)

## Key Dates

| Milestone | Date |
|-----------|------|
| Official Start Date | January 7, 2026 |
| End of Internship | April 15, 2026 |
| Weekly Updates Due | Saturday by 11:59 PM |

## Your Responsibilities

As an APM intern, you are expected to:

- **Confirm expectations** and ask clarifying questions as needed
- **Deliver high-quality work** and meet deadlines
- **Come prepared** to meetings with updates, questions, and next steps
- **Engage actively** and be open to feedback
- **Proactively communicate** progress, blockers, and availability
- **Build competence** by learning and applying necessary skills
- **Send end-of-week recap emails** to your manager/mentor with strategy-program@byu.edu in CC

## What You'll Be Working On

Students support teams in product management, AI product building, and product-adjacent roles, contributing to:

- Product discovery and customer research
- Feature definition and prioritization
- Prototyping and experimentation
- Analytics, insights, and execution support
